Class GameController.Shard

java.lang.Object
com.comp2042.controller.GameController.Shard
Enclosing class:
GameController
public static class GameController.Shard extends Object
Particle effect representing a single shard emitted from a cleared block.

  • Constructor Summary

    Constructors
    Constructor
    Description
    Shard(double x, double y, double velocityX, double velocityY, javafx.scene.paint.Color endColor)
    Creates a new shard with an initial position, velocity, and target color.

  • Constructor Details

    • Shard

      public Shard(double x, double y, double velocityX, double velocityY, javafx.scene.paint.Color endColor)
      Creates a new shard with an initial position, velocity, and target color.
      Parameters:
      x - initial X position in board coordinates
      y - initial Y position in board coordinates
      velocityX - initial horizontal velocity
      velocityY - initial vertical velocity
      endColor - color the shard will fade toward as it expires

  • Method Details

    • update

      public boolean update(double deltaTime)

    • getX

      public double getX()
      Returns the current X position of the shard in board-space units.
      Returns:
      the shard X coordinate

    • getY

      public double getY()
      Returns the current Y position of the shard in board-space units.
      Returns:
      the shard Y coordinate

    • getStartColor

      public javafx.scene.paint.Color getStartColor()
      Returns the initial color from which the shard starts its fade.
      Returns:
      the start color of the shard

    • getEndColor

      public javafx.scene.paint.Color getEndColor()
      Returns the final color toward which the shard fades over its lifetime.
      Returns:
      the target end color of the shard

    • getLife

      public double getLife()
      Returns the remaining normalized lifetime of the shard.
      Returns:
      remaining life in the range 0.0–1.0

    • getOpacity

      public double getOpacity()
      Returns the current opacity of the shard.
      Returns:
      opacity in the range 0.0–1.0
